TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void XmlChangedEventHandler(object sender, XmlEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed XmlChangedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub XmlChangedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As XmlEventArgs)
public delegate void XmlChangedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, XmlEventArgs ^ e);
type XmlChangedEventHandler = delegate of obj * XmlEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: An object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a field or group.

remarks.para: Important: The code skeleton for an event handler associated with the Changed event, which uses the XmlChangedEventHandler delegate, should be added only from the Microsoft InfoPath user interface. For more information on how to add event handlers in InfoPath, see How Do I: Add an Event Handler.
This type or member can be accessed from code running in forms opened in Microsoft InfoPath Filler or in a Web browser.

example.para: For an example of using the XmlChangedEventHandler delegate, see the sample code in the Changed event of the class.
